intro: Cyrtandra pilosicalycis, commonly known as the hairy calyx cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive hairy calyx that persists on the fruit. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine pubescence. The flowers are showy, with tubular corollas and five lobes, typically in shades of white or pale yellow.
